course.subject: LANG
course.name: Mediated Me: An Introduction to Digital Literacy
course.description: This introductory course will help students explore the impact of digital media texts (such as podcasts, memes, and social media like YouTube) on academic, professional and social communication practices. The course will enable students to be: critical of current digital communication practices; reflective of their communication and participation through digital media; aware of how digital communication can impact language delivery; and reflective of their English language development. To achieve this, the course guides students in developing basic knowledge of digital literacy theories and practices and to produce their own digital media texts for English communicative purposes. Students will undertake authentic tasks related to their academic and future careers that enables them to achieve the necessary communication skills in a digital world.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: YareYaredaze
reviews.title: honest review (real
reviews.comment_content:
well you won't remember anything you learn in this course. It is a blowing water course with some fancy terms.

I think you are able to get at least B if you know the concepts of multimodality: visual, aural or something in week 2. and keep blowing water in your essays.
reviews.comment_teaching:
good teacher, because you dont feel that he is actually teaching you and you dont need to remember anything from his class, which also means you dont need to attend any classes to get good grade. No attendance required.

You are requested to read the materials given each week before the class and you have to discuss these things during the start of the lectures with your groupmate (randomly sit every time). And yes actually majority of them won't read the materials. Only me do that sor jai.
reviews.comment_grading:
online open book quiz 2.5% x 4 = 10%
just ctrl + F and screenshot their animated lecture video (~10mins each week). Then you will be fine. Some answer can simply google it.

online discussion forum participation = 10%
group of 4-6 people, each people are assigned to be a leader that need to create a topic for discussion. members need to participate and you better reply like 3-4 times each section with sound evidence and concepts you see in the course.
[~200 word each reply.]

online discussion discussion forum leadership = 15%
You are assigned to be one-week leader and develop a topic related to the course, you need to reply to group members and summarize their point, encourage participation. Around 4-5 replies are needed. [~300word each reply]

Define Problem & Rationale = 5%
write something to talk about your on-going plans on the meme assessment.

Meme assessment = 20%
Create a Hong Kong meme, gif or png form, and explain it in 800words using the concepts you learn in this course.

Video + Rationale = 20% + 20%
Make a video related to hong kong , 5-8mins and explain your choice in ratonale (1200words)

me:
didn't focus on small points assignment and f***ing lose an A-. Got B+ at the end.
quizes: 8.33/9, 10/10, 7.5/9, 9.42/10
online discussion lead: 15/16
online discussion forum: 14/16
define problem + rationale: 11/16
meme assessment: 20/24
video + rationale assessment: 30/40

I just 9 calculate my score which is ~82.2% B+, another guy hit A- is ~85.1%. hope it save you some time.
reviews.comment_workload:
no presentation which is good for this course.
but lots of discussion + essays. i think in total you need to write like ~6000 words during the semester to get a good grade.

If you don't like writing or write so slow, it is a hell.
i need like 30mins to 1h to think and reply, i saw some people on my group can give some crazy good responses within 20mins, have specific reference lol.

Case by case, but nobody in my group used chatgpt to generate texts on discussion. (i check it everytime D: ), so good luck, I wont recommend it if you need to take another common core

reviews.author: AT0303
reviews.title: If you go into the classroom and see Sean, please stay in his session :)
reviews.comment_content:
Course Modules

Week 1: Defining digital literacies

Week 2: Multi-literacies and multi-modality

Week 3: Multi-literacies and multi-modality

Week 4: Meaning-making through digital media

Week 5: Re-mixing and mash-ups

Week 6: Hyper-reading and hyper-writing

Week 7: Online language

Week 8: Critical digital literacy

Week 9: Online cultures

Week 10: Digital practices: learning and literacy

Week 11: Digital practices: collaborative communication

Week 12: Digital practices: literacies at work

Week 13: Brave new world (NOT COVERED in this semester due to bad weather)
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the class schedule & quota website, it mentioned that MELICAN, Mark Anthony was our instructor, but it turns out to be Sean teaching us this semester. (while the instructor of the other session is still Mark)

One lesson per week (Blended Learning Mode); For some lessons, it became virtual because Sean is a busy person and he has to travel very often to attend conferences.

Flow of each lesson:
1. Submit a poll response
2. Sean goes through the PowerPoints
3. Do in-class group activities and discussions

Sean is an expert in the area of digital literacy and he explains the course content clearly and elaborated a lot with real-life examples. He is a very nice instructor and he is always willing to answer our questions about the course content and the assignment requirements. He encourages us to share our ideas in class but it is still fine if you don't know what to answer. When he knows that we are suffering from the mid term and final exam peaks, he is willing to extend the deadline of the assignments so we can have more time to finish them. For the main assignments, he gave us constructive feedback so we know how to improve in our next assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Good grading in Sean's Class (only for Sean)

Online Quiz x 4 (10%)
Online Discussion Forum Participation (10%)
Online Discussion Forum Leadership (15%)
Define Problem & Rationale (For the meme assessment) (5%)
Meme Assessment (20%)
Video Podcast + Rationale (20% + 20%)

My Marks:
Quizzes: 9/9; 9/10; 9/9; 9/10
Online Discussion Forum Participation: 14/16
Online Discussion Forum Leadership: 16/16
Define Problem & Rationale: 16/16
Meme Assessment: 19/24
Video Podcast + Rationale: 31/40

Final Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the biggest workload would be the video podcast because I am not good at video editing.
Even if you know nothing about video editing, there is no need to panic because Sean told us he doesn't care too much about how the video is edited. As long as you tried to apply the theories and techniques taught in class into the video, then it will be fine enough. After that, please mention those theories in your rationale paragraph to let Sean know what techniques you have used.

The second biggest workload is the online discussion forum. You will be assigned to a group and your group would need to have online discussions for six weeks (each person is responsible for leading the discussion for a week). The leader would have to think of a topic related to the course content and initiate discussions. The members would need to share their opinions and thoughts from time to time.

For the online quizzes and meme assessment, I think the effort required is relatively low. Online quizzes are open-book ones and you have 1 attempt only. Unlimited time is allowed to finish it. You can just search for the answers of online quizzes in the course materials. As for the meme, you can utilise existing online meme and modify a bit according to your topic.

Remarks:
- Not a must to do pre-class activities!!
- NO ATTENDANCE!!

reviews.comment_teaching: Blended learning mode: one lesson per week, have reading materials and pre-class tasks.  Mark is real shxt, He didn't really "teach". He just tell us some examples and tell us how the idea discussed in that lesson was used in the example.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz*4(2.5%*4 = 10%)
Meme Rationale (800 words)(5%)
Group discussion lead (10%)
Discussion participation (15%)
Meme assessment (800 words) (20%)
Video(5-8 mins) + rationale (1200 words)(20%+ 20%)

me:
quiz: full
meme rationale: 14/16
meme assessment: 18/24
group discussion lead: 10/16
Discussion contribution: 11/16
meme assessment: 30/40

Letter grade: C
reviews.comment_workload:
Shxt workload, you won't know what he wants. He gave unclear instructions on gradings, topic selections, etc. When sb ask him, he will ask us to figure it out ourselves without answering the question. The asm are totally waste of time, if you are not a good video editor, u gg.

During week 4 - 9 , you have to participate in online discussion on canvas. You will have to discuss with your groupmates. And group members take turns to be the leader of the discussion.
